meanings.definition: To bring to a premature end because of a problem or fault.
meanings.sent1: The storm forced us to abort our picnic.
meanings.sent2: The pilot decided to abort the landing due to strong winds.
meanings.sent3: I had to abort my baking mission when I realized I was out of flour.
meanings.sent4: The sudden power outage caused the computer to abort the printing process.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to abort the stakeout when his cover was blown.

meanings.definition: To terminate a pregnancy before the fetus is viable.
meanings.sent1: The doctor had to abort the pregnancy for medical reasons.
meanings.sent2: She made the difficult decision to abort the pregnancy early on.
meanings.sent3: The comedy sketch joked about a man trying to abort a food baby.
meanings.sent4: The character in the novel had to abort her pregnancy to save her own life.
meanings.sent5: The documentary discussed the history of laws regarding the right to abort a pregnancy.

meanings.definition: To stop a process or operation before it is completed.
meanings.sent1: I had to abort the download because it was taking too long.
meanings.sent2: The team decided to abort the mission due to safety concerns.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to abort the recipe halfway through when he realized he was missing an ingredient.
meanings.sent4: The manager had to abort the meeting when an urgent issue arose.
meanings.sent5: The software prompted the user to confirm if they wanted to abort the installation process.
